original_data.question: A 15-year-old girl comes to the physician because of episodic pelvic pain radiating to her back and thighs for 4 months. The pain occurs a few hours before her menstrual period and lasts for 2 days. She has been taking ibuprofen, which has provided some relief. Menses have occurred at regular 28-day intervals since menarche at the age of 12 years and last for 5 to 6 days. She is sexually active with two male partners and uses condoms inconsistently. Vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

options.A: Endometrial sloughing and uterine contractions mediated by prostaglandin
options.B: Ascending infection of the uterus, fallopian tubes, ovaries, or surrounding tissue
options.D: Hormone-sensitive smooth muscle tumor of the myometrium

model_response:
###Rationale: The most likely cause of this patient's symptoms is primary dysmenorrhea (painful menstruation). Primary dysmenorrhea is usually confined to adolescents and is associated with normal pelvic anatomy. It is characterized by painful menstruation with no other pathologic findings. The pain is usually confined to the abdomen, but may also radiate to the back and thighs. The pain is believed to be caused by prostaglandin-mediated endometrial sloughing and uterine contractions. The prevalence of dysmenorrhea is 40% to 90% among adolescents. A single, small, benign ovarian cyst (Option C) is unlikely to cause symptoms. A sexually transmitted infection (Option B) is unlikely to occur in the absence of risk factors. Leiomyomas (Option D) are uncommon in adolescents.

###Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human females as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
Having a black or dark core or plug.
Individuals licensed to practice medicine.
Intermittent pain, i.e., pain that occurs occasionally and at irregular intervals. []
The rear surface of an upright primate from the shoulders to the hip, or the dorsal surface of tetrapods.
The superior part of the lower extremity between the HIP and the KNEE.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli which are detected by NERVE ENDINGS of NOCICEPTIVE NEURONS.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.
A precursor cell which gives rise to a fully differentiated cell of hematopoietic lineage.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agent with analgesic, antipyretic, and anti-inflammatory properties

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.
A time period, or other type of interval, during which something may be achieved, obtained or observed.
The first MENSTRUAL CYCLE marked by the initiation of MENSTRUATION.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
A response indicating that an individual is or was sexually active.
A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
A sheath that is worn over the penis during sexual behavior in order to prevent pregnancy or spread of sexually transmitted disease.
Actions performed to measure temperature, pulse, respirations, and blood pressure
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.

Fundamental claims of patients, as expressed in statutes, declarations, or generally accepted moral principles. (Bioethics Thesaurus) The term is used for discussions of patient rights as a group of many rights, as in a hospital's posting of a list of patient rights.
